text: Is there an easy way to pull off a value from an array in HUBL like `array[0]`?

Dang - cold blooded - Ive never had any issues throwing SVG’s in here before. It might be a silly question as I’m sure youve already vetted it - but did you run this through any SVG optimizers before putting it in here that could have stripped them in that step?
I ended up looping and adding if statements but that seems wrong…
nope
tried hard setting them and then they turn into more Stops
It hurts my heart a little bit
HubL supports python array syntax so the above example should work
<@UQWGKUEN7> ended up dropping the SVG in hard coded
couldn't get around the darn thing
Hmmm Ill have to go around and check where I’ve done this - or at least think that I’ve done this and see if I actually used the Rte or not. But I swear I’ve done it this way before.
I am so annoyed.
:joy:
Just wanted to bump this because I wanted to get feedback on which of the 3 methods is the best practice. What do you all do?
A, but you need to change your syntax to my version above
So not to add fuel to the fire but I am not having any issues adding pretty big and ugly svgs into RTE’s
Yea, I guess it was a typo. Thanks
Hm. It's only the defs that are being impacted. I'll have to do a test tomorrow with a fresh one to see if the problem holds true
Question.  Is your file hosted in the File Manager, or the Design Manager.  Also, are you using the Command Line Interface?

Ah, thanks <@U3T21PDBK>, I think I misunderstood your comment in that you were just correcting the syntax, not answering a/b/c. Thanks!

<@U54TVT3C1> Hosted on File Manager. But I won't do it that route anymore if (A) is the best practice.
Yeah, I guess if you’re adding a source to an image at the template level, keeping your image files in the design manager and using `get_asset_url()` is the way to go.
